title: How to Make Red Velvet Cupcakes With Cream Cheese Icing

steps.headline: Fill a muffin tin with liners.
Use an electric mixer and blend the butter and sugar until fluffy.
Add the egg and mix well.
Combine the cocoa and food coloring in a small bowl.
steps.description: Don't worry about how powdery it probably looks at this stage––that's normal. Add the cocoa mixture into the blend.

steps.headline: Sift the salt and flour onto wax paper.
Add salt, flour, vanilla, buttermilk, and water to the mixing bowl.
Mix the vinegar and baking soda in a separate bowl.
Fold this mixture into the mixing bowl.
Pour the batter evenly into the liners.
Blend the cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add the powdered sugar and vanilla.
Spread the cream cheese icing onto the cooled cupcakes.
steps.description: Serve or arrange in a suitable shallow box for a gift.

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Fill a muffin tin with liners.  Use an electric mixer and blend the butter and sugar until fluffy.  Add the egg and mix well.  Combine the cocoa and food coloring in a small bowl. Don't worry about how powdery it probably looks at this stage––that's normal. Add the cocoa mixture into the blend. Sift the salt and flour onto wax paper.  Add salt, flour, vanilla, buttermilk, and water to the mixing bowl.  Mix the vinegar and baking soda in a separate bowl.  Fold this mixture into the mixing bowl.  Pour the batter evenly into the liners.  Bake for 25 minutes. Store covered overnight. Making the Cream Cheese Icing Blend the cream cheese and butter until smooth.  Add the powdered sugar and vanilla. Blend until smooth. Spread the cream cheese icing onto the cooled cupcakes. Serve or arrange in a suitable shallow box for a gift.
